column1: ;Component
;ABC12
;The required header row fields are: Component, Qty, SKU, M.R.P., Tax Code, HSN Code
;The other fields are optional and will depend on your product's characteristics.
;Component: SKU that you want to add in the vitural combo as a component
;Qty: Number of items of the sku that you want to add in the virtual combo.

;SKU: Unique,alphanumeric (may or may not contain special characters) The sku (Stock Keeping Unit) is a unique name for your product. The sku must be labeled on your product for the Fulfillment Centre to easily identify it.

;Product Group Code: Alphanumeric(may or may not contain special characters). It is used for grouping of multiple SKUs. For example: 'S' and 'M' size of one Product Group Code will have different SKUs.
;EAN: International Article Number (or European Article Number) for the product.
;UPC:Universal Product Code is assigned to retail merchandise that identifies both the product and the vendor that sells the product.
;GTIN:Global Trade Item Number is an internationally recognized system for identifying products.
;Aliases: Any other name of the product. (add comma seperated values if multiple)
;Title: Short title for your product.It should not be more than 100 characters.
;M.R.P.:It is the maximum retail price of product that is assigned by its manufacturer for selling in India.It can not be negative and less than unit price
;Tax Code:The tax code will be used to calculate the applicable tax amount of the product. Refer to below table for Tax code mapping.
;HSN Code:It is used for the classification of goods in systematic and logical manner and was developed by Worlds Custom Organisation(WCO).
;Make available on: Enter the name of the channel on which you want to make the product available. In case of multiple channels use ; to seperate the channel name.
;Make unavailable on: Enter the name of the channel on which you want to make the product unavailable. In case of multiple channels use ; to seperate the channel name.
;Custom Field Key: Use custom field name as the header to define the value. (Example, name of custom field: Color, Header of the csv will be Color)
;Custom Field Value: Use custom field value as the value to define the custom field. (Example, Custom name: Color, Custom Value: Red)
;ESBGST1: if tax applicable is 5% or 12%
;ESBGST2: if tax applicable is 5% or 18%
;ESBGST3: if tax applicable is 0%
;ESBGST4: if tax applicable is 0%
;ESBGST5: if tax applicable is 18%
;ESBGST7: if tax applicable is 5%
;ESBGST9: if tax applicable is 12%
;ESBGST10: if tax applicable is 3%
Component
